abstract: Some Republican presidential candidates continue to oppose resettling refugees in America, despite Pope Francis' pleas for their acceptance on recent American visit; stance resonates with conservative voters who fear terrorist infiltration and disagree with many Democrats and some Republican presidential candidates, that America's founding principles require acceptance.
lead_paragraph: While Pope Francis, visiting the United States, challenged Americans to embrace a more open mind-set toward newcomers, some of the candidates for president are viewing the issue of resettling refugees here with indifference, concern and resistance.

headline.main: Politics and Philosophy Clash Where the Pope Urges an Embrace of Refugees
